Module c486.c486assessmentproject
Package Controller

Class AddProductController

java.lang.Object
Controller.AddProductController
All Implemented Interfaces:
javafx.fxml.Initializable
public class AddProductController extends Object implements javafx.fxml.Initializable
This is the AddProductController class, and it controls all elements on the add product screen.
It allows the user to enter in data for a new product and to save this information by creating a new Product object.
This screen contains a topProduct table which contains all current available parts in the management system.
The user can select parts from this table and click the add button which will add that part to the associatedPartsTable below.
The user can select an associated part from the associatedPartsTable and click the remove associated part button to remove that part from the table.
The user can then press save button which will save that product to the allProducts array list in the Inventory class, as well as saving all the parts in the associatedPartsTable to the associatedParts array list in the product class.
If the user clicks cancel it will prompt the user that all data entered will be erased without saving and if ok is clicked, the user will be returned to the main form page.

    private static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part>
    productAssociatedParts
    Array list that will contain the associated parts added into the associatedPartsTable.
    This list will be passed over to be added into the associatedPartsTable in the Product class and will be referenced for the instance of product being created.
    static int
    productId
    Variable that contains the unique ID value for each product.

    It is initialized to 999 initially, because when the first product is added in the saveProduct method, productId is incremented by 1 making the first product id value 1000.

    Method
    Description
    void
    blankTextError()
    This method displays an error alert dialog box letting the user know a text field is left blank.
    void
    cancelToMain(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method confirms with the user before returning the user to the main form if the Cancel button is clicked.
    static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part>
    getAssociatedPartsTable()
    This method retrieves and returns the productAssociatedParts array list.
    void
    initialize(URL url, ResourceBundle resourceBundle)
    This method is the override initialize method that is called first once the addProductController is called.
    This method populates the available parts table with the allParts array list from Inventory.
    void
    onAddAssociatedPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method adds the selected part from the top parts table into the bottom associated parts table.
    It adds the parts added into the associatedPartsTable into the productAssociatedParts array list which then will later be added into the Product AssociatedParts array list.
    void
    onProductPartSearch(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method extracts the input data from the search field and calls the lookUpPart method from the Inventory class and searches through the array list for a match and returns the results to the partTable.
    If no results are found an error message is displayed saying no results are found.
    void
    RemovePart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method removes the selected associated part from the bottom associated part tableview.
    void
    saveProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
    This method saves the Product object to the Inventory allProducts arraylist.
    The parts added into the associated parts table will be added into the Product AssociatedParts array list.
    There are multiple input validations checking for blank text fields,incorrect data types, and logic errors for the inv, min, and max text field values.
    The method returns the user to the main form after the save button is clicked.

  • Field Details

    • productAssociatedParts

      private static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> productAssociatedParts
      Array list that will contain the associated parts added into the associatedPartsTable.
      This list will be passed over to be added into the associatedPartsTable in the Product class and will be referenced for the instance of product being created.

    • blankError

      private String blankError
      Private String variable that is initialized to null at first.
      It will be reinitialized to the current text field's name later during the input validation checks for null values in the text fields.

    • productId

      public static int productId
      Variable that contains the unique ID value for each product.

      It is initialized to 999 initially, because when the first product is added in the saveProduct method, productId is incremented by 1 making the first product id value 1000.

    • onAddAssociatedPart

      public void onAddAssociatedPart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method adds the selected part from the top parts table into the bottom associated parts table.
      It adds the parts added into the associatedPartsTable into the productAssociatedParts array list which then will later be added into the Product AssociatedParts array list.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - When the add button is clicked below the top parts table.

    • RemovePart

      public void RemovePart(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method removes the selected associated part from the bottom associated part tableview.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - When the remove associated button is clicked.

    • saveProduct

      public void saveProduct(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method saves the Product object to the Inventory allProducts arraylist.
      The parts added into the associated parts table will be added into the Product AssociatedParts array list.
      There are multiple input validations checking for blank text fields,incorrect data types, and logic errors for the inv, min, and max text field values.
      The method returns the user to the main form after the save button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - When the user clicks the save button.
      Throws:
      IOException - - When the user enters a String value inside a text field expecting a numerical value.

    • onProductPartSearch

      public void onProductPartSearch(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent)
      This method extracts the input data from the search field and calls the lookUpPart method from the Inventory class and searches through the array list for a match and returns the results to the partTable.
      If no results are found an error message is displayed saying no results are found.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - When the user presses enter when the focus is on the search text field.

    • getAssociatedPartsTable

      public static javafx.collections.ObservableList<Part> getAssociatedPartsTable()
      This method retrieves and returns the productAssociatedParts array list.
      Returns:
      - The productAssociatedParts array list.

    • cancelToMain

      public void cancelToMain(javafx.event.ActionEvent actionEvent) throws IOException
      This method confirms with the user before returning the user to the main form if the Cancel button is clicked.
      Parameters:
      actionEvent - - Cancel button is clicked.
      Throws:
      IOException - - When the fxml file cannot be found.
